comments.commentBody: See if we can get a trade in discount for the other Boras client Ollie.
We in West Irondequoit couldn't be prouder.

Until companies are required to include the negative externalities into their business plans, we will continue to have the lowest tier (read citizens) paying for the disaster! Corporations will simply declare bankruptcy and move on to reorganize and leave the problem behind.

40% of the US productive costal marshes are in the Gulf of Mexico and will not be valued unless we are in danger of losing them. What a shame; we will all be much poorer for this loss and the damage will not be repaired in my lifetime and probably never.

The mentally disabled progressive liberals and Sierra club idiots stopped nuclear power. This is the price. The mentally disabled liberals are running America into the dirt, and stuff like this if proof, QED.
Give each BP exec a straw and tell them to suck it up!

How about a new rule? If you are a government agency which is responding to problems generated by corporate ineptitude or malfeasance - you are not allowed to "underestimate" the potential damage resulting from those problems.

I'll take anyones bet that the dispersants used to "HIDE" the oil spill's magnitude (from the press) made this cleanup much worse. If all this oil had been confined as much as possible from the beginning, they could have "herded" it better today (and tomorrow). Instead, as we learn, it's broken up into so many clumps, many still underwater, that there is no way to get cleanup crews ahead of it.

How does this oil spill compare to US multinational behaviour i.e. "An Indian court has convicted seven former senior employees of Union Carbide's Indian subsidiary of "death by negligence" for their roles in the Bhopal gas tragedy that left an estimated 15,000 people dead more than a quarter century ago." (Adelaide Advertiser 8 June 2010). Publish the magic multiplier effect that magnifies tragedy when western people are affected by something vis a vis Eastern Third Worlders?
This makes Katrina look like a spring shower.
Isn't the wide-spread dispersal of oil the likely result of massive use of oil dispersants?

The government has not sent down any of its own subs, high-resolution cameras, technicians or engineers to determine itself how much oil is gushing out of that hole. Why in the world do we only get the one BP live feed?

Not one of us knows how many oil gushes there even are. It has been said that there are other leaks down there. US Government run, owned, managed and manned subs should be down there surveying the entire area in detail, and taking their own measurements. This is incompetent: to leave the estimates and reporting of those estimates to BP. Who is BP? Just a British company. BP has no jurisdiction over those waters or those beaches. They can't limit access to any of those sites, and they can't limit measuring and reporting what is going on there.

Where is the official US witness to what is going on right down there at the oil gush site?? If they can launch space shuttles and put people on the moon and figure out how to create life generated by a computer, surely the government can take some live-video footage of its own a mile beneath the surface of the ocean. Where is Robert Ballard?

We need an American sub down there with some good ol' down home American cops in it to at least document and film everything that is going on right at the leak site. Right now. This should have been done on Day 1. BP is not telling us how much oil is gushing out because they do not want us to know. This is just ludicrous.

Hopefully, the good people of Arkansas will do all of us a favor and retire Blanche Lincoln.

One by one. . .the corporatists have to go.

Blue House had good, patient and helpful front desk staff who went beyond merely giving directions and making reservations. I had several long and informative discussions with front desk people about Turkey. It's in Sultanahmet, and close to most historic attractions. The tram is almost at the door which gives cheap, fast, clean service to the Euroapian side of the city, which allows a traveler to get away from high restaurant prices in Sultanahmet. We ate at the hotel restaurant (which I usually avoid) which was a fine meal for a fixed price. Downside: lobby bar and laundry prices are wildly expensive, $4.50 for a very small cup of tea.You need to notify the front desk when you are leaving so they can place a room card in the slot in your room, otherwise the a/c doesn't work while you are out of the room. Although there is free wireless internet throughout the hotel, it is a serious oversight to not have at least one computer station for guests who don't carry laptop/notebook computers with them. The breakfast is Mediterranean and doesn't offer variety usually experienced by people from the Usa and Uk, or not consistently every morning we will stay Blue house, again, when we next come to Istanbul. Thank you!
Stay here if you can't afford the Ciragan Kempinski.
www.bluehouse.com.tr

In my opinion, a mixture of civilians on a mercy mission would be greatly intimidated by the boarding in the dark of fully armed and trained soldiers and would be unlikely to attempt to fight back in such a violent manner. On the other hand, if persons on that ship had been previously trained for a violent confrontation for public relations purposes, what occurred is perfectly understandable.

People should know the truth about what is happening so they cn make political decisions at the voting times and pressure their so called representatives to do what's right. Covering up the deaths of civilians so that investigations and justice might happen is as wrong as covering up prison torture such as water boarding and outright lies about WMD that lead to war. This kind of warfare which George W. Bush has defined as "right" has brought America to the level of the 9/11 perpetrator's mentality. Nihilism, a simpleton's rational, replaces whatever America once had in leadership like D. Eisenhower... an American patriot.

If the Israeli soldiers were so badly beaten by the activists, and they didn't do anything to provoke or harm the activists, then why won't they allow an international inquiry?

For that matter, since an American was killed, why aren't we insisting on it?

People with Asperger's learn rules about right and wrong and rarely understand the ethics behind them. For Lamo, in a black and white world, Manning broke the rules.  For a large portion of the rest of us, it was the Army that broke the rules and Manning is a hero for exposing this.

Sometimes information should be withheld in order to prevent it from being used against the brave men and women on the ground. However, it's ludicrous that information is withheld in order to "protect our troops" while the best way to protect them is to not have them fighting unjustified wars built on deceit and misinformation.

Finally, some pictures are posted of these boys being attacked by 'humanitarians'.  But the nytimes puts this evidence in a tiny corner of the website where no one can find it, while the 'brutality' of Israel was top news.  This seems fair.

If you walk what you talk, do something about it.
This is unconstitutional against the freedom of speech. He didn't commit treason. it was classified for the wrong reasons. They don't want the home morale and support to drop and emboldening our adversaries. Let's keep fighting this war which offends all. Let's dribble yet another American drop in a war that wasn't ours to fight.
I was looking for a leader in Obama, all I've got is another politician. sigh :(

Lamo says ‘What if somebody dies because this information is leaked?’  What if somebody dies because it isn't?  That is, more than the hundreds of thousands who have already died in Iraq "for their own good" in this lie-based, holocaust for oil access for Bush's oil rich financial backers, started by war profiteering traitors who themselves never served in combat or dodged the draft (Bush, Jr., Cheney, Rove), and that has drained Americans of their blood and tax dollars, and allowed Bin Laden and the 9/11 murderers to get away in Afghanistan/Pakistan.

In the latest interview with Al Jezeera, the Sri Lankan President categorically denied that, no civilians were killed by his army, and accused the rights groups having their own agenda to discredit him and his country. It is a sad state for sanity when the UN itself has released numbers at one point of the war, that more than 7,000 civilians were killed and describing the situation as “Blood Bath on Beach". The Sri Lankan President was also adamant that he will not allow any international investigation by any foreigners to investigate his county and his armed forces. HRW, AI, and ICG recently released reports with reliable evidences that Sri Lankan forces were responsible for war crimes against Tamils and said 40,000 or more civilians might have been killed in the final days of the war with Tamil rebels May 2009. Now, Sri Lankan defence secretary’s angry outburst in BBC hard talk only proving one thing, him and other political leadership who were responsible for the large scale massacres now sacred of truth coming out through their former Army Commander and wanted to silence him for ever, and they are ready to even hang him to shut his voice permanently as they have done away with so many of the dissent voices without any consequences so far!.

"In hindsight, perhaps confusing a large group of activists already enraged at Israel’s military blockade of Gaza by firing shots of any kind in their direction in the dark was a recipe for disaster." - WHAT?!? These were PEACE ACTIVISTS, were they not?? There were 5 other boats where nothing of this sort of "rage reaction" took place. Why this one? Because they were not peace activists on a humanitarian mission, but rather jihadists looking to beat up and kill Israeli soldiers. WAKE UP ALREADY!

I applaud and agree with David Cooke's comment (#26) on the one hand.  On the other hand, this is just the latest example of the same old story when it comes to treatment of Israel.  The propaganda coming out of the pro-Arab side has really matured in its savviness and its cynical manipulation of world opinion.  They get away with murder in more ways than one.  Because Israel is forced into maintaining maximum muscle power and because they don't have good PR, their enemies play it for all it's worth.  But it's not new.  It does seem more and better though.  How does Hamas get away with killing enemies, denying supplies to non-Hamas members, AND make themselves seem like victims?  This Israel as racist apartheid regime baloney has been repeated so many times, it's become the modern Goebbels effect.   I never know if it's lack of knowledge or hatred that drives some of the comments I read, but it would be nice to see the media, like the NY Times, start doing their job of providing some perspective on both the Middle East stories as well as the rest of the world.
Never again!
